extension.searchTitle: END TAXPAYER FUNDED CELL PHONES ACT OF 2016; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 99

congVote.result: So (two-thirds not being in the affirmative) the motion was rejected.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: End Taxpayer Funded Cell Phones Act of 2016
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House failed to agree to suspend the rules and pass the following measure:<P/>H.R. 5525, to prohibit universal service support of commercial mobile service and commercial mobile data service through the Lifeline program, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 207 yeas to 143 nays, Roll No. 334.

extension.searchTitle: SUPPORT FOR RAPID INNOVATION ACT OF 2016; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 99

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Support for Rapid Innovation Act of 2016
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 5388, to amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to provide for innovative research and development, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 351 yeas to 4 nays, Roll No. 335;

extension.searchTitle: LEVERAGING EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES ACT OF 2016; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 99

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 5389, to encourage engagement between the Department of Homeland Security and technology innovators, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 347 yeas to 8 nays, Roll No. 336;
